name.en: Topics in Mathematical Image Processing Ⅰ

goal.ch: 本課程主要是「MA3111數學影像處理」的配套課程，我們將進一步介紹基於偏微分方程和變分方法的圖像處理高等數學技術。本課程強調實際實施和電腦模擬。此外，每個學生都必須完成一個有關圖像處理的研究項目並進行數次演示。
goal.en: This is a companion course of the「MA3111 An Introduction to Mathematical Image Processing.」 We will continue to introduce advanced mathematical techniques for image processing based on partial differential equations and variational methods. This course emphasizes practical implementation and computer simulations. In addition, every student must complete a research project on image processing and make several presentations.

outline.ch:
This course will cover the following topics of image processing:
(1) Advanced PDE and variational methods for image denoising, decomposition, fusion, contrast enhancement, dehazing, segmentation, etc.
(2) Sparse representation and dictionary learning with applications to image processing
outline.en:
This course will cover the following topics of image processing:

textbook.ch:
無指定課本，主要為自編教材投影片及部份專業期刊論文。

其他參考書：
(1) G. Aubert and P. Kornprobst, Mathematical Problems in Image Processing: Partial Differential Equations and the Calculus of Variations, Second Edition, Springer Verlag, New York, 2002. 
(2) T. F. Chan and J. Shen, Image Processing and Analysis: Variational, PDE, Wavelet, and Stochastic Methods, Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics, Philadelphia, 2005. 
(3) D. Cremers, Computer Vision I: Variational Methods, Online Resources, Departments of Informatics ＆ Mathematics, Technical University of Munich, Germany, 2019/2020. 
(4) R. C. Gonzalez and R. E. Woods, Digital Image Processing, Fourth Edition, Pearson Education Limited, New York, 2018.
textbook.en:
No textbook, but we will provide some slides and journal papers. 

Below are some references:  
(1) G. Aubert and P. Kornprobst, Mathematical Problems in Image Processing: Partial Differential Equations and the Calculus of Variations, Second Edition, Springer Verlag, New York, 2002. 
(2) T. F. Chan and J. Shen, Image Processing and Analysis: Variational, PDE, Wavelet, and Stochastic Methods, Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics, Philadelphia, 2005. 
(3) D. Cremers, Computer Vision I: Variational Methods, Online Resources, Departments of Informatics ＆ Mathematics, Technical University of Munich, Germany, 2019/2020. 
(4) R. C. Gonzalez and R. E. Woods, Digital Image Processing, Fourth Edition, Pearson Education Limited, New York, 2018.
